intro: Hieracium miansarofii, commonly known as the Miansarof hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are typically lance-shaped and serrated. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium miansarofii is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
